purpleculture_pinyin:
zhuàn
to earn; to make a profit
заработать; получать прибыль

zuàn
to cheat; to swindle
обманывать; обманывать
rtega_mnemonic:
賺賺RS
赚赚		make money, earn, gain, profit, cheat
  • huge amount of money 貝 combined in a stack 兼: money one has earned by cheating
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 赚)
Pictophonetic: 兼 indicates the sound; 貝 (money) conveys the meaning.
Antonyms: 賠
purpleculture_examples:
賺錢 [ zhuàn qián ]: to earn money; moneymaking
賺取 [ zhuàn qǔ ]: to make a profit; to earn a packet
賺頭 [ zhuàn tou ]: profit (colloquial)
賺哄 [ zhuàn hǒng ]: to cheat; to hoodwink; to defraud
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 貝 [ bèi ] sea shell; money, currency
    • 兼 [ jiān ] both, and; at the same time; to unite, to combine
heisig_chinese_memo: If you have double the shells this year that you did last year then you earned something.
Ru_trainchinese:
zhuàn: (глаг/сущ) получать прибыль; зарабатывать (деньги); (неформ.) прибыль
zuàn: (глаг) (книжн.) обманывать, вводить в заблуждение
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: If you want to earn double the shells just work some O.T.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " Bei " and " Jian ", it means gaining and winning. One of Tang Laihu's "Illustrations": "The green lotus frost breaks all night, so that he won't become pearls in the autumn rain."

" Earning " can mean gaining profit. Ming Tang Yin's "The Song of the First World": "People in the world can't make enough money.

" Earning " also means a delay. Song Xuxuan "Supplements from Ji Shenlu‧ Jiaofang Le Renzi": "Surprise, make money! This is a bigu medicine."

" Earning " is also one of Song Dynasty songs. Also known as "Not Road". Staggered application of loose and fixed plates, generally used in large-scale curved forms. There are many preserved in the later Nanqu. Song Wu Zimu's "Meng Liang Lu-Prostitute Music": "During the Shaoxing period, there was Doctor Zhang Wu Niu, because he heard the "Tai Ping Decree" in the drum board or earning the drum board, and now it is the rhythm of the big festival, so he wrote " Earn”. Earn, the meaning of making mistakes is just as beautiful as it sounds, but it’s coming to an end. It’s not suitable for a film sequence.”

" Earning " can also mean cheating and slandering. "Quan Tang Poems" Volume VIII, "Renhu": "From then on, you must close your eyes when you see the mountain, and you have been profited by the mountain for a long time."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " Bei " and " Jian ", it means gaining and winning.
humanum_full_description:
從「貝」，「兼」聲，表示獲得、贏得。唐來鵠〈偶題〉之一：「一夜綠荷霜翦破，賺他秋雨不成珠。」

　　「賺」可表示獲得利潤。明唐寅〈一世歌〉：「世人錢多賺不盡，朝裏官多做不了。」

　　「賺」也表示貽誤。 宋徐鉉《稽神錄拾遺‧教坊樂人子》：「訝，賺矣！此辟穀藥也。」

　　「賺」也是宋代歌曲之一種。又名「不是路」。散板與定板交錯應用，一般用於大型曲式之中。後之南曲中保存頗多。宋吳自牧《夢粱錄‧妓樂》：「紹興年間，有張五牛大夫，因聽動鼓板中有《太平令》或賺鼓板，即今拍板大節抑揚處是也，遂撰為『賺』。賺者，誤賺之之義也，正堪美聽中，不覺已至尾聲，是不宜為片序也。」

　　「賺」還能表示哄騙、誑騙。《全唐詩》卷八七二載〈朝士戲任轂〉：「從此見山須合眼，被山相賺已多時。」
humanum_short_description: 從「貝」，「兼」聲，表示獲得、贏得。

    English Definition: to earn; to make a profit

" Earning" can mean gaining profit. Ming Tang Yin's "The Song of the First World": "People in the world can't make enough money. " Earning" also means a delay. Staggered application of loose and fixed plates, generally used in large-scale curved forms. There are many preserved in the later Nanqu. 賺字的基本解释

賺
zhuàn

賺
zuàn
均见“赚”。

賺字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhuàn］
［《集韻》直陷切，去陷，澄。］
“赚1”的繁体字。
(1)获得利润。
(2)赢得；获得。
(3)口语。挣（钱）。
(4)误，贻误。
(5)宋代歌曲之一种。又名“不是路”。散板与定板交错应用，一般用于大型曲式之中。后之南曲中保存颇多。
[②]［zuàn］
“赚2”的繁体字。
哄骗；诳骗。

賺字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【貝字部】　賺； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页1211第17
【集韻】直陷切，音詀。賣也。一曰市物失實。　又【集韻】離鹽切，音廉。義同。　【集韻】與?同。

賺字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
賺字的起名意思

暂无。

earn
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zhuàn］
["Jiyun" straight cut, go to sink, clear. ]
The traditional characters of "make 1".
(1) Gain profits.
(2) To win; to obtain.
(3) Spoken language. Earn (money).
(4) Mistakes, delays.
(5) One of Song Dynasty songs. Also known as "Not Road". Staggered application of loose plates and fixed plates, generally used in large-scale curved forms. There are many preserved in the later Nanqu.
[②]［zuàn］
The traditional characters of "Jiang 2".
Deceive; deceive.
earn
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Unitary Collection] [Beijing Department] 　zhuan; Kangxi Strokes: 17; Page Number: Page 1211 Page 17
【Jiyun】Straight sinking and cutting, with sound. Sell also. One said that the city's property was inaccurate.　[Jiyun] Cut from salt, with low sound. The same meaning.　【Jiyun】Same as ?.
